page.title: 03Moravian Settlement Manch'r
page.content: At Manchester's Moravian Settlement we found that they still keep up old traditions after 200 years.The Moravians got their name from the two countries they came from, Bohemia and Moravia, now in Czechoslovakia.The settlement's oldest building is the church and people still think it is the most important.There are 150 dwellings in the square.Nobody knows when the traditional costume went out of fashion because the Moravians did not think that it was important to write it down.During the war people used to take it in turns, including women, to stand in the church clock tower and watch for fires.At the moment the square is being renovated. It is estimated that it will cost a quarter of a million pounds.1985 is the bi-centenary.They are having lots of celebratons.
